summary: This is an internal email chain from July 9, 2019, providing an operational update on the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. It details the status of locating and serving grand jury subpoenas to 10 co-conspirators, plans to interview approximately 25 victims in Florida, and the activation of a tip line. It also notes the schedule for Epstein's bail arguments and hearing.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation and upcoming bail proceedings. The email discusses operational activities related to his case.

events.title: Epstein Bail Argument Deadline
events.description: Epstein's bail argument is due to the judge by this date.

events.title: Epstein Bail Hearing
events.description: The actual bail hearing for Jeffrey Epstein is scheduled for this date.

events.title: Investigation Update and Victim Interviews
events.description: The investigative team (8 Special Agents and 2 AUSAs) is flying to various locations in Florida to interview approximately 25 victims. An update on locating 10 co-conspirators is requested and partially provided.

keyFacts: There were 10 identified co-conspirators in the Epstein investigation as of July 9, 2019.
By this date, 3 co-conspirators in Florida, 1 in Boston, 1 in NYC, and 1 in CT had been located and served with grand jury subpoenas. 4 remained outstanding, including a wealthy businessman in Ohio.
An investigative team of 8 Special Agents and 2 Assistant U.S. Attorneys was deploying to Florida to interview approximately 25 victims.
A dedicated FBI tip line (1-800-CALL-FBI) had been activated and had received approximately 45 calls, which were being vetted.
Epstein's bail argument was due to the judge by Thursday, July 11, 2019, with the bail hearing set for Monday, July 15, 2019.
